awd_titl_txt: Role of RNA Processing in Mitochondrial Gene Expression
awd_abstract_narration: The aim of the study is to examine the mechanisms involved in                   regulating the stability of messenger RNAs (mRNA). An early focus               will be on the mechanism of RNA turnover and the enzymes involved,              using a combination of genetic and biochemical approaches.  The                 model system will be the yeast Saccharomyces cerevisiae, and both               cytoplasmic and mitochondrial mRNA stabilities will be examined,                ultimately.                                                                                                                                                     The regulation of gene expression in eukaryotic organisms involves              the coordination of both initiation of transcription as well as RNA             processing at the post-transcriptional level.  This study is aimed              at elucidating the mechanism of RNA turnover and an understanding               of the enzymes that catalyze this significant process.
org_div_long_name: Division of Molecular and Cellular Biosciences

perf_inst.perf_inst_name: Saint Louis University School of Medicine
